Ben Hutton

  • Fri, Nov 19, 2021 - @smoyac @kinlane @OpenApiSpec @AsyncAPISpec @jsonschema Where is this? What did I misss?
  • Fri, Nov 19, 2021 - @owenrum This looks cool, but isn't it better to catch the problems BEFORE commit and prevent the commit all together? Or, report CI issue in a PR check?
  • Fri, Nov 19, 2021 - @CardamoneLuigi @awwscript That library is a much better solution for dynamic form generation than using JSON Schema. Especially if you want to load data dynamically.
  • Fri, Nov 19, 2021 - @CardamoneLuigi @awwscript My suggestion would be dont use JSON Schema. It‚Äôs not designed for generating forms so unless you find a library which provides all the things you want, you‚Äôre going to be wasting a lot of time IMHO. https://t.co/jKu9uSaubn provides a rich JSON powered form builder! I‚Äôd use that
  • Thu, Nov 18, 2021 - One thing I struggle with is the dynamic nature of my job. I have work I schedule, but then I also want to react and participate in active discussions. I‚Äôve tried to have set times I engage with live discussions, but I don‚Äôt always find it practical. Any thoughts/tips?
  • Thu, Nov 18, 2021 - @awwscript @CardamoneLuigi @jsonschema Right, it‚Äôs two different concerns. I‚Äôm hoping we will cover referential integrity in some way in the database vocabulary, but it‚Äôs not going to call out to http with specific paginated responses expected. That‚Äôs more a hypermedia concern.
  • Thu, Nov 18, 2021 - @awwscript @CardamoneLuigi @jsonschema When I said not a common use case, I was specifically talking about pagination. I‚Äôd argue this is a detail mostly related to form or UI generation. You know, there‚Äôs an effort to create a form generation vocabulary.
  • Thu, Nov 18, 2021 - @CardamoneLuigi @jsonschema Autocomplete is different from pagination. It‚Äôs more a search. Query string. That‚Äôs really outside the remit of JSON Schema, unless you provide all values. Autocomplete in IDEs is great, but always needs the full schema.
  • Thu, Nov 18, 2021 - @CardamoneLuigi @jsonschema If you want to get direct access to all the JSON Schema people, we have a great slack server, and open office hours. You can find links to both and more on our recently updated home page üòé
  • Thu, Nov 18, 2021 - @CardamoneLuigi @jsonschema If you care enough, you could take a look and see if there's an issue here: https://t.co/Er5qzaHjB0 OR you could create one if not. It's not expected that anything will happen with these for some time, but tracking a call to action is still useful. üôè
  • Thu, Nov 18, 2021 - @CardamoneLuigi @jsonschema it may seem like a very common use case, but in reality, it isn't, because the solution is OK. There have been some attempts to have external data endpoints, but no one has wanted it enough to make it happen.
  • Thu, Nov 18, 2021 - @CardamoneLuigi @jsonschema This is actually the solution. Implementations should make no assumptions about having internet access or being able to make HTTP requests. I HAVE seen a solution which did this for an ontology, and it's a great example of what could be a vocabulary.
  • Thu, Nov 18, 2021 - @CardamoneLuigi @jsonschema Alternativly, create a single schema which holds all the values, and reference that from the first schema. That's the only interoperable approach. No pagination though.
  • Thu, Nov 18, 2021 - @CardamoneLuigi @jsonschema I don't believe there's currently any tooling that would support such a thing. Sorry. You would have to create a new custom keyword, but then you'd also have to write impelementation extensions yourself too. ...
  • Wed, Nov 17, 2021 - I don't want to make this thread sound like library author/maintainer bashing. They have done a lot of good work. The name of the library is poor, and we're going to be paying for it for years to come. Naming things is hard... but important to get right.
  • Wed, Nov 17, 2021 - ...remove ALL references from a schema, but it WILL remove EXTERNAL references. It also will not work with @OpenApiSpec documents, yet. It is not published on npm yet either, but go watch the repo. This is the future of JSON Schema and OpenAPI bundling.
  • Wed, Nov 17, 2021 - While @jsonschema doesn't currently provide any tooling, one of our core team decided to throw something together in a few days. Still in beta, but already has broad JSON Schema support and good starting documentation. https://t.co/DEVtimqDGt What it won't do is...
  • Wed, Nov 17, 2021 - If you use anything but very basic JSON Schemas, you're likely going to run into problems. Since this tool was created, JSON Schema defined a bundling process. I wrote about it: https://t.co/vXKWfgTgg5 But, what about tooling to support this now defined process?
  • Wed, Nov 17, 2021 - üòï`json-schema-ref-parser` is a popular tool used to "dereference" a JSON Schema... but should it be? It implements "JSON Reference" and "JSON Pointer". It is NOT JSON Schema aware üò¨ https://t.co/MZIatcZz6a The library is, frustratingly, terribly named üò¶ üßµ...
  • Wed, Nov 17, 2021 - ‚Äúthe service that performs underlying updates to the registry data determined which package to publish based on the contents of the uploaded package file.‚Äù - GitHub fixes authorisation vulnerability in the NPM JavaScript package registry https://t.co/QiyYw467YL
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - üì¢Want to write modern @jsonschema in @code?üì¢ üëáRespond to this issue with an upvoteüëá https://t.co/RRXgNIBXyU The issue is in the backlog, but that doesn't mean it has any priorty, and isn't scheduled work. Let's see if we can change that!?
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - The Pull Request I've created will introduce the same warning for any JOSN document which identifies as using the 2020-12 dialect (JSON Schema draft 2020-12). https://t.co/KQmxPnNz4R It's unexciting, but could potentially save a lot of false assurance and debugging time! ü•≥
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - I believe this is because VSCode is retreiving the 2020-12 meta-schema, and treating it as a normal JSON Schema, defaulting to the implementations most current dialect for validation processing.
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - In JSON Schema, unknown keywords are ignored. I explain in an issue I created today, a JSON Schema file which uses the 2020-12 dialect URI in @code will be creating a false positive in terms of validation. It will NEVER show any validation errors. https://t.co/qmSNRqu2nZ https://t.co/WTwMAoN5NR
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - This was added some two years ago: https://t.co/5LOYf9xGoS I made a PR to fix the error message around the same time: https://t.co/ukrJma2ZsZ But, right now, there's no such warning for draft 2020-12, so what's happening?
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - You might notice that in the previous images, JSON Schema draft-07 was used. This is the latest version of JSON Schema @code supports. When someone tries to use draft 2019-09, they get a warning against the `$schema` value, stating that it's not supported. https://t.co/TdlZiulVTw
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - ...you get autocomplete and validation. This is pretty neat for authoring JSON Schemas. It's also automatically applied to files at specific locations using https://t.co/fLlcUqSAZ8 It stops you making potentially silly mistakes. This is the only way I write JSON Schema documents https://t.co/5skcLQZ0gm
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - In a recent post, someone asked about Visual Studio support for newer versions of JSON Schema. A later comment included the quote in the first part of this thread (https://t.co/hlrE2MfwTQ) In VSCode, if the file type processing is JSON, and the root object includes `$schema`...
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - Drafts? JSON Schema is released as "drafts" from version 1-7, then proceeding with 2019-09 and 2020-12. @code? VSCode allows for validation of JSON Schema baked in. That's the mechansium through which you get autocomplete/intelisense AND validation in your config files üòé
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - üßê"@code is properly able to use JSON Schemas based on the 2020-12 draft." üò¨ I'm afraid that would be a false positive. üîÄ I've made a PR to hopefully avoid this in the near future!) üëá Let me explain...üßµ
